96060471-d-06-27-96-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Other general switching rules (Provide detailed  description in narrative)
96060471-d-06-27-96-SOO.Accident Cause: Other general switching rules (Provide detailed  description in narrative)
96060471-d-06-27-96-SOO.Narrative: SIDE COLLISION & DERAILMENT ON THE WEST END, BETWEEN TRACK 47C & 45C IN ST PAUL, MN OCCURRED ON THURSDAY, JUNE 27, 1996 BETWEEN JOB 4710 & 4758. ASSIGNMENT 4710 TIED ONTO 45C, DID NOT CUT IN THE AIR,HAD A SINGLE UNIT & AFTER A DELAY OF ABOUT 20 MINUTES, STARTED TO PULL WEST ON 45C. AT THIS TIME, ASSIGNMENT 4758 WAS PULLING IN ON 47C, ENGINES SOO 2057 AND SOO 2011 AT ABOUT 7 MPH. THE ENGINEER OF ASSIGNMENT 4710, OOPERATING UNIT SOO 1534 HAD THE HEAD LIGHT ON & WHEN HE COULD SEE ASSIGNMENT 4758,HE SET THE INDEPENDENT & AUTOMATIC BRAKE IN ORDER TO GET SOME ADDITIONAL BRAKE PRESSURE. AT THE TIMETHE ENGINEER, SWITCH FOREMAN & UTILITY MAN WERE IN THE CAB OF UNIT 1534, TRAVELING ABOUT 4 MPH. WHEN IT BECAME APPARENT THAT THE ENGINEER WOULD NOT BE ABLE TO STOP THE TRAIN, THE SWITCH FOREMAN & UTILITY MAN GOT OFF THE ENGINE. THE ENGINEER CONTINUED TRYING TO STOP THE TRAIN & REVERSED THE ENGINE TO STOP. BY THIS TIME, ENGINE 1534 HAD IMPACTED ASSIGNMENT 4758. ENGINE 1534 WAS RERAILED, ONE LOAD WAS TRANSFERRED & THE ENGINEER WAS TAKEN TO THE HOSPITAL FOR TREATMENT & DRUG SCREEN UNDER FRA GUIDELINES. ENGINEER WAS SUSPENDED FOR 30 DAYS & FRA DECERTIFIED.NoneNoneNone
